subhead: Did the terrorist organization target France on November 13, 2015 because of its military operations or the values it represents? The timeline of events and accounts from jihadists reveal a tangle of complex causes.

Judge says hundreds of people detained in Chicago's immigration crackdown could soon be released on bond
subhead: Attorneys for the detainees hailed US District Judge Jeffrey Cummings' decision as a win. As Cummings described the circumstances under which immigration agents have arrested people since the start of 'Operation Midway Blitz,' he deemed it 'highly unlikely (...) that any of these foreign nationals' were what ICE has labeled the 'worst of the worst.'

title: Germany acts as mediator to help France and Algeria save face with Boualem Sansal's release
subhead: The writer was pardoned by Abdelmadjid Tebboune on Wednesday before flying to Berlin. German mediation allowed the Algerian president to avoid appearing as if he had yielded to France.

title: Mimmo the dolphin, Venice's latest attraction
subhead: Since the start of summer, the dolphin has delighted tourists but raised concerns among Venetians. Experts have mobilized to move him away in order to prevent injuries.

title: 10 years after Paris attacks: The new life of a former Bataclan hostage
subhead: In December 2015, Marie Hourcastagnou declined to speak to Le Monde when we profiled her husband Arnaud, the last hostage to be freed by the police. Ten years later, she agreed to share her story.

subhead: In a joint interview, Denis Peschanski and Francis Eustache discuss the November 13 Program, launched in early 2016. This unique multidisciplinary project combines research in the humanities, social sciences and neuroscience.

title: Yann LeCun considering Meta exit amid AI strategy overhaul
subhead: The French artificial intelligence researcher is reportedly working on launching a start-up, according to American media, as Mark Zuckerberg reorganizes Meta's internal teams.

title: Antonin Tron appointed Balmain's new creative director
subhead: The 41-year-old French designer, who founded his own label Atlein and worked for several prestigious Parisian fashion houses, has been chosen to succeed Olivier Rousteing.
